questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)?
Which data structure uses a 'Last-In, First-Out' (LIFO) approach?
In Java, which keyword is used to inherit a class?
What is the time complexity to access an element in an array by index?
Which pillar of OOP allows methods with the same name but different parameters?
Which data structure uses nodes where each node points to the next one?
Which sorting algorithm has the best time complexity for already sorted arrays?
Which keyword is used to declare a constant variable in Java?
Which of the following is the default access modifier in Java?
Which method is used to get the length of an array in Java?
Which of the following is true about a Binary Search Tree (BST)?

options.a: All nodes have exactly two children
options.b: Left child contains keys greater than the parent node
options.c: Right child contains keys greater than the parent node

questions.question: Which OOP principle does method overriding represent in Java?
What is the time complexity of inserting an element at the beginning of a singly linked list?
Which of the following is NOT an advantage of using a heap data structure?

options.a: Efficient access to the maximum or minimum element

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the 'protected' access modifier in Java?

options.a: Accessible only within the same package
options.b: Accessible within the same package and subclasses
options.c: Accessible only within the same class

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'this' keyword in Java?

options.b: To reference the current instance of the class
options.c: To import classes from another package

questions.question: Which data structure is most suitable for implementing a LRU (Least Recently Used) Cache?
What will happen if a base class constructor does not have a no-argument constructor and a subclass constructor is called without explicitly invoking the base class constructor in Java?

options.c: Implicit call to a default constructor

questions.question: Which of the following data structures is best suited for applications like a call center with multiple queues?
Which sorting algorithm is stable and uses divide-and-conquer to sort the elements?
Which data structure allows O(1) complexity for both insertion and deletion but does not store elements in sorted order?
Which design pattern allows an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes?
In a red-black tree, which of the following properties is always maintained?

options.a: Every node is either red or black
options.b: The tree is balanced based on the height
options.c: Each leaf node must be red
options.d: No path from root to leaf can have more than three black nodes

questions.question: Which of the following problems can be efficiently solved using dynamic programming?

options.a: Binary search in a sorted array
options.b: Shortest path in an unweighted graph

questions.question: What is the time complexity of Dijkstra's algorithm when implemented with a priority queue?
Which of the following is true for the Floyd-Warshall algorithm?

options.a: It works only for acyclic graphs
options.b: It uses backtracking to find paths
options.c: It finds the shortest paths between all pairs of vertices
options.d: It only finds the shortest path from a single source

questions.question: What is the amortized time complexity for inserting an element into a dynamic array?
In Java, which of the following methods is used to prevent cloning of an object?
Which graph traversal technique is most suitable for solving a maze with multiple paths?
Which scheduling algorithm is preemptive and allows processes to be interrupted based on their remaining burst time?
